paragraph.value: With BIVEC embeddings, we learn two languages at the same time, and test retrieval on one or two of these languages. Results are shown in table 4. Trained in English alone, the model gives

paragraph.expression: "non � riconosciuto come comando interno o esterno"

paragraph.value: performance than MUSE for languages not seen previously. For example, with English-German BIVEC and a model trained only in English, and test on German, we obtain only

paragraph.expression: "non � riconosciuto come comando interno o esterno"

paragraph.value: % recall@10, where MUSE embeddings obtain 44.18%. But when train on English and French, we obtain

paragraph.expression: "non � riconosciuto come comando interno o esterno"
"non � riconosciuto come comando interno o esterno"

paragraph.value: % compared to MUSE. With German and English training, we have an increase of

paragraph.expression: "non � riconosciuto come comando interno o esterno"

paragraph.value: % on English only recall, with a recall of 61.44%. Meaning that, once again, learning a new language with BIVEC enables

results in English, as the same kind of results is visible with French as well.
